page.title: 16SOCIAL CONCERNS : THE SURVEY
page.content: In Whitehawk there were fewer worries about{vandalism}and{bus services expressed by people we asked than in Queen's Park. Many were worried about lack of facilities for the old and the {unemployed.}The general state of the houses and gardens was better in Whitehawk than its reputation suggested. The more mixed area of Kemptown revealed that alongside the pleasant gardens and Regency houses of Sussex Square people were living in some{financial difficulty}and were worried about the state of their houses and the{safety}of the area at night. What we think is most striking is the contrast in attitudes and styles of living in a small area and what can be revealed by actualy looking and asking.
